dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pale orb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny bedroom. Priest's. cell. Spare. Moody shadows from the window. A large cross on the wall. THE SENTINEL lies on a bed. He is an ancient old man. His eyes flicker, cloud over... Slowly, he expires. HIS HAND: as he dies, the Sentinel's hand siowly opens, revealing an ornate black box -- sealed -- like a miniatu coffin, which slips between his lifeless fingers... THE FLOOR: as the ornate box lands on the hard wood...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE MAIN TITLES. “PRINCE OF DARKNESS".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idyllic campus. Charming ivy-covered buildings. STUDEN stroll the grounds. PAN WITH a PRETTY CO-ED on a bicycle to REVEAL: BRIAN MARSH, 24, a graduate student in physics, newly arrived on campus, walks down a sunlit courtyard carrying ah -armload of’ textbooks. He glances over... BRIAN'S POV: near a fountain. CATHERINE MIDWOOD, 24, talk with another FEMALE GRADUATE STUDENT. They seem to be telling each other jokes, laughing. Catherine is pretty. Open. Intelligent. Tomboyish, in a way. CLOSE ON Brian as he slows, watches... HIS POV: Catherine walking away with her friend... And Brian can't resist looking over his shoulder at this beautiful girl as he enters 'The Feynman Institute of oe Physics'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SCREEN. Continue MAIN TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens an a NUN, 50s, appears. She steps inside the tiny cell... HER POV: the Sentinel lying still as death in his bed... The Nun says something m.o.s., gets no response. Then she looks down... HER POV: that ornate box lying on the floor... AN HOUR LATER: THE PRIEST, 50s, leans over a small table in the corner of the Sentinel's room. He is a strong- willed man, his eyes direct, humorless. In b.g. the Nun watches as the priest reads... PRIEST'S POV: an old weatherbeaten notebook. At the top of the yellowed page is written: “Brotherhood of Sleep". The priest reads on, his brow furrowing... PRIEST'S POV: EXTREME CLOSE-UP. In the middle of a page of handwriting, see the phrases: "...the sleeper wakes... and, right below, "...can no longer keep..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR HOWARD DIRAC, 50s, a theoretical physicist, wal across campus carrying his briefcase. Dirac is of Chinese ancestry, a determined-looking man. He glances around at the students going to their classes... LOW ANGLE: we see Dirac walking toward the physics buildi in b.g. In f£.g.-is a mound of grass, and under the brigh green grass and leaves see thousands of ants scurrying madly... Dirac stops at the entrance to the physics building. He glances up into the morning sky... DIRAC'S POV: a strange alignment in the early morning sky The moon is visible directly above the sun... [EFFECT] BLACK SCREEN. More TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful expanse. Trees. Green lawns. The priest shakes hands with a BISHOP and ARCHBISHOP, two berobed luminaries of the Roman Catholic Church. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The three men talk m.o.s. Out of doors, on the quiet grounds, it's private here, somehow -- among the flowers. They are serious. Intent. Out of his pocket the priest brings something to show them... THE PRIEST'S HAND: the ornate box. He opens it, and insid is a large silver key... BLACK SCREEN. Continue MAIN TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Dirac is lecturing to a graduate physics class. The class is small. The brightest of the bright. There's WALTER, 30s, Chinese. KELLY, 20s, pretty and outgoing. MULLINS, 30s. FIVE OTHER STUDENTS listen, take notes...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Let's talk about our beliefs and what we can learn about them... We believe nature is solid and time is constant. Matter has substance, time a direction. There is truth in flesh and solid ground. The wind may be invisible, but it's real. Smoke and fire, water and light -- they're different, not as stone nor steel, but they're tangible... Now we see Brian sitting near the back, not paying all th much attention to the lecture, looking at: BRIAN'S POV: Catherine, sitting a few rows in front. She listens attentively, taking notes... Brian does stare somewhat dreamily at her...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: And we assume time has an arrow. It is as a clock -- one second is one second for _everyone. Cause precedes effect. Fruit rots, water flows downstream, we're born, we age, we die. The reverse never happens. A beat as Dirac pauses, a slight smile... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: None of this is true. Say goodbye to classical reality, because our logic collapses on the subatomic level -- into ghosts and shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest stands in front of a huge abandoned church somewhere in Los Angeles. It is immense. Gothic. Its spires sweep upward into the sky. The priest looks at the old abandoned church with a sense of unease...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, dusty hallway. The priest walks slowly along. His FOOTSTEPS ECHO. It's eerie. in here, the sunlight drifting in large, high windows. Now the priest stops at a huge iron door. Extremely old. Mammoth. It looks bomb-proof, earthquake-proof, other Act of-God proof... The priest pauses a moment by the iron door. Then he take out that ornate box, removes the key, inserts it in the l BLACK SCREEN - More TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks along. He slows, looks over... BRIAN'S -POV:. Catherine enters the university book store Brian stops. Glances at his watch. Parks himself by a bench to wait. He looks up... BRIAN'S POV: the night sky. Huge full moon. Leaves of a nearby tree swish silently in f.g. [EFFECT} Brian now looks over... BRIAN'S POV: Catherine comes out of the book store with a HANDSOME MAN, 27. They laugh and talk. He could be a student, a teacher, athlete , who knows? Hard to tell if they're just friends or on a more intimate basis... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian. He looks somewhat disappointed. But he's not sure either...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest is writing at a table-top computer. He is tense, driven. He finishes typing, punches a couple buttons, and the printer begins CLACKING madly as it type out what he's written... PRIEST'S POV: the printer. An address CLICKS across the page: "Professor Howard Dirac, Feynman Institute of Physi CLOSE ON the priest: he has a distant expression. EXTREME CLOSE-UP: the paper, as the printing element SNAP across: "...of the utmost urgency..." BLACK SCREEN. TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirac is lecturing again...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: From Job's friends insisting that the good are rewarded and the wicked punished, down to scientists in the 1930s proving, to their horror, a theorem that not everything can be proved, we've sought to impose order on the universe... Brian's not paying attention during this lecture either. He. looks at... BRIAN'S POV: Catherine, who listens interestedly...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: But we've found something very surprising. While order does exist in the universe, it is not at all what we had in mind... Now Brian glances over at the windows letting in that war California sunlight... BRIAN'S POV: a black limousine pulls up in front of the physics building. It's ominous somehow, that big black car against the verdant green of the campus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: —, Sf f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After class. Graduate students wander out of the lecture hall. Catherine comes out, walks by CAMERA. a beat later, stops, watches her... Brian exits BRIAN'S POV: Catherine walking away down the hall... Brian. He's definitely in love. sees... Or close to it. BRIAN'S POV: a MOTHER SUPERIOR walking down the hall, passing Catherine, coming this way... MEDIUM SHOT: Brian, as Dirac emerges from the lecture hal passes Brian and moves o.s. BRIAN'S POV: as Dirac is met by the Mother Superior. talk m.o.s. -- they're just far enough out of earshot. the Mother Superior hands Dirac a sealed envelope... Brian, as Waiter drifts over to him...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) What's this?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. Dirac did that series of debates on the B.B.C. a few years ago...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh, with the priest, right...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe they're planning another one... BLACK SCREEN. MORE TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up in front. of a California Spanish mission. Dirac emerges from the car. Walks up some steps into a portico. Looks off... DIRAC'S POV: a group of NUNS walking, their robes billowe by the wind, their habits fluttering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o™ i }

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: at Behind Dirac the priest walks out of the mission, comes up to him. They shake hands, talk m.o.s. They seem happy to see each other, renewing an old acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirac and the priest enter an ornate sanctuary inside the mission. They move away from CAMERA and now the priest tells Dirac something m.o.s. We don't hear, but Dirac is absolutely stunned by what the priest is saying. Alarmed. Then nonplussed. +e te CLOSER ANGLE, to hear...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: He died before his appointment with the Cardinal -- but he left a diary... The priest hands Dirac the notebook...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: You've got to help us... Please. Dirac searches the priest's expression, finds only fear.. BLACK SCREEN. TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spartan. Spare. Lots of books stacked around. A messy bed. Brian sits at a desk, shuffling a deck of cards. He' practicing a magic trick, making a card disappear in his hand. | But he's bad at it, and the card keeps dropping o onthe desk. Frustrated, he glances up now at an old TV set with its sound turned down... BRIAN'S POV: TV. The news is on and the ANCHOR is talking m.0.8. SUPERIMPOSED OVER is the legend: "NEW DISCOVERY". Then we see a photograph of a distant galaxy, and we ZOOM IN on a glowing, exploding star -- a supernova... SHOOTING OVER THE TV on Brian as he comes up to the set, turns up the sound, returns to the desk... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/97

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: (v.0.) ++. took place in pre~Cambrian times, and scientists say the light from this stellar explosion is just now reaching us across the vast gulf of space... NOW CAMERA BOOMS DOWN... and across the back of the IV set are thousands of ants racing around madly 9} on 1 the ‘surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Dirac and the priest step from a limousine and walk to the old crumbling church...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest and Dirac step in to the dilapidated front hal move past some stairs to a hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to that massive iron door. The priest inserts the silver key...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +.+ and the iron door swings open on to a long stone stai way that leads downward. There are no windows in here. Th priest turns on a flashlight and leads Dirac down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come off the stairway into an old, crumbling hallway Unlike the church upstairs, it resembles some ornate old catacombs. CAMERA MOVES WITH them down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Who knew about this?

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Only members of this forgotten sect. The Brotherhood of Sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 32 33 34 35 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they move down a dank corridor. Dark. Water drips from above. The priest's flashlight beam spins around the walls. They seem to be going deeper and deeper...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: This was built in the 1500s. The altar was moved here from England. Before England, it was in Rome...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: The Vatican didn't know?

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: The guardian priest would keep the secret, and before he died would pass it on to another... They turn a corner... into a strange hallway. There are crosses on the stone walls. Everywhere. The small hall s wet, ancient. Dirac and the priest stop, and CAMERA MOVES IN, PANS, and we see they are standing in a mezzani over looking a huge underground church built deep in the bowels of the earth under the abandoned church above... Now see something glowing in the apse -- a weird yellow glow... It's a container of some kind...

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: BLACK SCREEN. Final TITLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirac and the priest enter the underground church. It is moist, dripping in here. There are literally hundreds of crosses everywhere -- on the walls, on stanchions, on the floor. The priest lights a few candles. Dirac is clearly stunned. They start down the aisle toward the front, CAMERA MOVING WITH THEM. Dirac stares ahead. The priest looks anxious, almost frightened... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee ee ae

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DIRAC'S POV: we MOVE TOWARD a large transparent canister of liguid in the apse. All the crosses seem to point toward this canister as if some sort of evil were being held at bay. It is sealed with a heavy, screw-on lid. It looks vastly old. Dirac and the priest walk, the flashlight beam spinning, staring... DIRAC'S POV: MOVE IN CLOSE on the canister. The mold and corrosion on the top and bottom of the canister look pre- historic. Inside the sealed compartment there is a weird water dance -- the liquid, a faint yellowish color, glows and swirls -- somehow alive! Dirac and the priest stop in front of the canister. The priest lights several candles. Below the canister is an 1d book on a podium. The priest carefully opens the book, shines the flashlight on its yellowed pages...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Latin.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: The original text has been distorted through the years...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Distorted?

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Rewritten. Changed. Dirac leans forward, gingerly examines the book...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: It's been written on two or three times and improperly erased. You see -~ the original text is still visible -- underneath. Dirac looks back up at the strangely glowing canister. Th priest stares at it, too. There's an unmistakable look on their faces -- dread, fear...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Can you feel it?

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Yes... Something... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: It was never there before. It started a month ago...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: What started?

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: A change -~ in the earth and sky... His power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Walter walk together on their way to class. CAMERA MOVES ALONG with them...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What don't you get?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The whole thing. It doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: It violates common sense, that's the whole point. That's what Einstein couldn't accept.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I can't accept it either. (beat) Do you know anything about Spontaneous Human Combustion?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Walter, come on... Schrodinger's Cat...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I know, I know... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o~

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: So, what's the point? The point is, until the cat is observed by someone, he is not in any definite state, alive or dead. He is in a wave superposition state, both dead and alive at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Only when we open the box and observe the cat does he material- ize into reality, either dead or alive...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But it doesn't make sense...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's the entire, complete point. It doesn't make any common sense, our common sense breaks down on the subatomic level.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Why do I want a Ph.D. in this?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Particle beam weapons, research grants...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: A-millionaire when I'm 40 -- now I remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Walter walk down the hall... CATHERINE'S POV: MOVING SHOT of Brian leaning against the wall opposite the door to the lecture room. He's looking back at her. Only two of the other students from Dirac's class are here ~- Kelly and Mullins... Catherine smiles at Brian as she and Walter stop at the lecture hall door, stare at a note taped there... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: You're not going to like it... THEIR POV: the note: “CLASS CANCELLED. THE FOLLOWING STUDENTS SEE PROF. DIRAC..." A list of names follows.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: 'The following students...' Shit, there I am...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Me too...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I hear Dirac wants us to cancel our plans for the weekend...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (horrified) What? .

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: That's not all... A couple of Biochemistry's finest are coming with us...

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: And someone to translate Latin...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Coming with us where? Nobody knows... As Walter turns and walks moodily away...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to pull some strings, here, this is just not gonna happen. I have serious plans for the weekend...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Four o'clock, Walter. Dirac's office... (turns to the ‘ others) I'll have to ditch Pagels again, e and he's not going to like it... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Sleep with him -- get your A...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (as she leaves) You're a wonderful person... Now Mullins drifts away too, as Brian smiles at Catherine

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: So what about your plans?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I was going to study, actually.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (relieved) Yeah, me too... I'm Brian Marsh, by the way, since we're spending the weekend together...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I know. Catherine Midwood.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Brian and Catherine walk along, CAMERA DRIFTING WITH them...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Where did you transfer from?

dialogues.speaker: . BRIAN
dialogues.text: Kneale. Theoretical Physics. I came here to study with Dirac. You're Applied Physics? (she nods) So why are you taking Dirac for theory?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I want to tknow what the math means.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Dirac's ruthless. He wants e philosophers, not scientists. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I read his books. He's a brilliant man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in a beautiful courtyard outside the Philosophy building...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Sounds mystical, doesn't it? Observer-created reality.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I started solving differential equations when I was a sophomore. At first it was just an exercise. Solve the math, no big deal. But then when I started to think about what all this math implied... Strange way to find out things aren't the way I thought they were...

dialogues.speaker: . CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Sometimes just as I think I've got it, visualized it -- it all goes away. I start seeing old-fashioned classical reality. I want the clockwork back. I want to put it all into a little box, but whenever I try, it slithers out... Brian reaches in his pocket, comes out with his deck of cards...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Some things aren't changed by quantum physics...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Every theoretical physicist I know wonders why nobody who looks like you seems to ever settle down in our end of the building... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sb

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's not true and that's an extremely sexist thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Confirmed sexist. Proud of it. (but now he sees that a wall has gone up around her) Hey, wait... I'm just teasing you... Brian tries to do the card trick. He screws it up again, the cards falling to the ground. He hopes she'll laugh. She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What's the deal? You talk numbers, you get romantic. You talk people, you clam up. Catherine's jaw locks. She's tense and guarded, and yet she smiles. It's a social amenity she obviously doesn't feel...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Just a little miscue, that's all. It's not your fault. I'm sorry. I'11 see you later...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Look, this conversation is not what I had in mind at all. Can we just try this all again? Catherine looks at him, then relaxes, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: You see, I was hoping you needed more help with theory. So we could discuss it -- maybe over dinner or something, say...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: With a confirmed sexist? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 16A.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (as he picks his cards up off the ground) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I suppose something could be arranged. There are other things I need help with -- over dinner... Now she's smiling at him. Brian puts the cards into his pocket... (CONTINUED)
on; Co 39 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: So maybe that wasn't a boyfriend or husband the other night?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, Catherine, Walter, Kelly and Mullins are seated in front of Dirac...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: I have volunteered our services to the archdiocese. Each of you is a competant physicist, even though you don't have a degree to prove it. (glances at Walter) Participating in this examination will greatly improve your classroom averages, I might add.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks sheepish...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Plan on eating your meals there. We'll bring cots to sleep on. There are other departments joining us...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: ‘Excuse me, sir. Is there a reason why you're not telling us what we're going to be doing?

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: (a beat as he looks at Brian) In time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: r Dirac stops in front of the abandoned church. He carrie a suitcase. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DIRAC'S POV: the ediface rising ominously into the blue sky. Dirac now glances over... DIRAC'S POV: down the street. A bus stop. A BAG LADY is seated, rigid, a petrified Pompeiian mummy with a mask like face. Her shopping cart full of yellowing newspapers and broken appliances sits nearby... Dirac, as he looks closer... CLOSER: the bag lady. She lifts her right arm slightly, from the elbow, in a strange salute -- and begins slowly rocking her head back and forth, over and over again... EXTREME CLOSE: across the dirty flesh of her cheek crawl a few ants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS. The moon is squashed, compressed and enlarged, hanging dead in the night sky behind the Los Angeles sky- line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirac and the priest sit in an old office in the abandone church. Dirac has a cot set up in here, his clothes hang- ing out of the suitcase. It's dark, damp -- only low light from a couple lamps...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: It your disbelief that powers him. It's your stubborn faith in common sense that allows his deception... It's hard to tell from Dirac's expression whether or not he fully believes all the priest is telling him.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: He lives in the smallest parts of it. The atoms. Smaller. Invisible. He lives in all of it, the sum of the parts... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: You must translate the book. You must prove it scientifically, convince the outside world...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Outside world doesn't want to hear this kind of bullshit. Just keep it locked away -- you've already managed that for two thousand years...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: No prison can keep him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine comes out of the physics building, leaving from a late class. Brian is waiting outside for her...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Getting cold out here. This is supposed to be California.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Did you have a class tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Library. I was really hoping Maybe you'd have a cup of coffee with me again...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (smiles) This is getting to be a habit. (beat) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning sunlight filters in through the faded curtains, cold and grey. Brian and Catherine are asleep in his bed, under the covers... CLOSER. Now Brian's eyes flicker and open. He carefully untangles himself from Catherine's arms and gets out of bed without waking her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian emerges from his small apartment bungalow into the cold morning air. He glances off thoughtfully, filled wit excitement, going through his feelings... He looks up... BRIAN'S POV: the sun and moon, side by side, rising over the horizon... [EFFECT].

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEW MINUTES LATER. Catherine opens her eyes, looks over Brian has made them both coffee... .

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Good morning. She smiles at him sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: We didn't get much sleep...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Who needs sleep?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: We. do. Today's Friday. Brian comes over to her, kisses her tenderly...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Can I just tell you something?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Please don't.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I want to.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Tell me next time, if there is one -- or the time after that. Or two years from now... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ad 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 20A.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Who was he? The one who gave you such a high opinion of men? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 21.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian just looks at her...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I wouldn't like it if either of us jumped to conclusions.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: How do you know I was going to say what you think I was going to say?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Because if you don't, I don't want to know... At which, he kisses her again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIDE SHOT of the old church as a small van pulls up in front. CLOSER on the van, as Catherine, Kelly, LISA, 20s, Asian, a theologist, and SUSAN, 30s, a quiet student of Radiolog get out. They each carry over night bags and stand staring at the church. CLOSER ON Catherine and Kelly as Catherine looks where * Kelly indicates with a nod of her head. THEIR POV: across the street, by an alley, THREE STREET PEOPLE stand very still, silent, watching them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIDE SHOT LOOKING TOWARD the front, the downtown L.A. * skyline in b.g. CAMERA PANS WITH the van as it moves past, revealing Dirac overseeing the beginnning of the careful unloading of the trucks in the rear of the church. Brian, Mullins, CALDER, 20s, a Microbiology major, and WYNDHAM, 30s, a biochemist, begin downloading scientific equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, empty storeroom has been turned into the Women's Sleeping Quarters. Cots line the walls. The girls enter from a hall... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C 2ia.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Please don't tell me... They put their overnight bags down, look around.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: This place gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It was abandoned...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I'd have never guessed.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I hear it used to be a beautiful church...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: 1953. My husband's parents used to come here. Then for some reason it was closed down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old sanctuary on the second floor is being turned into a make-shift scientific lab. Equipment is wheeled in a doorway by Brian and Walter. Wyndham sets up a chemistry lab over on a large table. Mullins sets up a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty office. Funky. Bookshelves. Catherine sets up a computer, plugs it in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Walter carries a roll of electrical cable out of the sanctuary, comes to the end, hooks it up to another roll held by LOMAX, 30s, from the Engineering Dept. Brian has stopped by a broken window and looks out...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I really can't believe this is happening. I had a date tonight with this beautiful young trial attorney from Century City...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Where were you taking him?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Please, it isn't funny. Now Walter glances out the window... WALTER'S POV: the front of the church. Now see FIVE MORE STREET PEOPLE standing there, not moving, staring back at the church...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: Watching us. They started coming around when I got here at 9 this morning... : (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 53A
dialogues.text: 54 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" = 4/25/87 23.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Calder and Wyndham come up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: CALDER
dialogues.text: I'm Calder -- Microbiology.

dialogues.speaker: WYNDHAM
dialogues.text: John Wyndham. Biochemistry. They all shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Brian Marsh.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Walter Fong.

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: Lomax. Engineering.

dialogues.speaker: WYNDHAM
dialogues.text: Anybody know what this whole deal's about yet?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Not a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the old book, as it's opened to the first page of Latin. Dirac stands behind Lisa. She's very self-assured, capabl at her computer terminal.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I'mgetting my doctorate in theology. Analysis of ancient scriptures. This shouldn't be too difficult... She stares at the Latin text a moment, then begins typing each phrase from the book into the computer... CLOSE: Lisa's computer screen: "I, JESUS, HAVE SENT MINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In b.g. is the church. In f.g. is an abandoned car. Crawling across the hood are spiders by the hundreds. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 54 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A limousine pulls up in front of the church. The priest gets out, walks, stops a moment, looking around... CLOSE: the priest. His eyes Look up... UP ANGLE: the spires of the church. Up there in the sky is the impossible alignment: moon over sun, in broad day- light... [EFFECT] CLOSE: the priest, now glances down... HIS POV: down the street 2 BAG LADIES stand watching him. The priest, starts to walk forward, steps right into a da shape standing on the sidewalk in front of him! It's the Bag Lady Dirac saw days earlier. Her eyes are bright, glistening. She holds a small paper cup in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: BAG LADY
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful thing you're doing -- opening the church again... The priest nods, starts by her, glances in the paper cup. 5 HIS POV: the paper cup has a strange dark substance at th bottom, like dried meat, and it is filled with maggots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest closes the front doors. Dirac comes up behind him quietly, watches the priest tremble...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: We're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest leads Dirac, Brian, Walter and Lomax to the hu iron door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: r «+. as they descend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... as Lomax strings out more cable down the dank corrido around a corner into the strange cross-lined hallway up t a portable generator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL CUTS: as many small floor lights on stands, like H.M.I. lights, BUZZ ON, flooding the underground church with light. : The group stands in silence staring up toward the front of the church... Only Susan and Lisa are absent... THEIR POV: the canister of ghostly, glowing, swaying liqu looking very much as if it's living...

dialogues.speaker: INT, CUBICLE
dialogues.text: CLOSE: computer screen. "MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER OF HARLOTS, AND THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH..."
dialogues.text: Lisa stares at what she's just written, a kind of formles dread beginning inside her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: computer screen, as mathematical data spews across it. Arcane, impossible differential equations... Catherine types the figures into the computer from hand- written notes. She looks over the top of the screen... CATHERINE'S POV: the window. Massing, swarming, leaping and flying up against the glass are nearly 100 moths! They flutter fur: ously in’ into one another, trying to g through ‘the glass barrier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is staring at the canister as Brian and Walter hook up a bizarre-looking piece of equipment next to it...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: There's a good reason why nobody's opened this thing, right?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Because we don't know what's in it. Let me have your pen for a second... (CONTINUED)
Cy 62 CONTINUED: She gives him a fountain pen which he uses to delicately probe the innards of the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of toxic crap?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Could be...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Okay, but I still don't understand why we're not taking direct samples. What's the big mystery? Brian gets up, goes over to a small computer terminal nea by, punches a couple keys, calls up line after line of ma blipping across the screen...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Catherine's entering these equations upstairs. They're sii, translated from Latin...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Differential equations?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: In a book written two thousand years ago...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But we hadn't invented differ...

dialogues.speaker: . BRIAN
dialogues.text: Right. Kelly and Walter exchange glances, and then Kelly turns t leave. She bumps her arm against one of the stanchions that holds a large cross...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Mullins accompanies Catherine quickly into the room, She's showing him... THEIR POV: now the window is completely covered with moth e@ 64 INT. CUBICLE Lisa translates Latin, as Dirac stands behind her watchin (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE: computer screen. "AND THE PRINCE OF DARKNESS WAS

dialogues.speaker: SATAN, WHICH DECEIVETH THE WHOLE WORLD..."
dialogues.text: Lisa and Dirac, as she stops typing, looks at him... As Susan, the radiologist, comes into the room with some x-rays in her hand...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Professor Dirac -- I don't think we have too much to worry about. The lid on that thing won't open. Dirac takes the x-rays, looks at them up against the ligh

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It's incredibly elaborate. There's a weird locking mechanism. Looks like it can only be opened from the inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights on in a couple halls, rear windows. A slight breeze. And suddenly the dark shape of a TATTERED BAG MAN steps into frame f.g., moving slowly past the church, watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another old office has been made into a lounge of sorts. Lots .of opened Pizza Man and Chinese food boxes. An ice chest, soft. drink cans spread around, ash trays, etc. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" ~ 4/25/87 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Walter sits drinking coffee, staring grumpily at a portable TV set someone was thoughtful enough to bring... WALTER'S POV: the TV. A cartoon is on. An old Tom and Jerry, the one where Tom is sent to Hell. A bulldog Devil with horns, cape and pitchfork cavorts in the fire and brimstone... Walter gets up, glances at Kelly standing at the window. She's rubbing her arm...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm going back.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Look at this... Walter comes over, looks out... THEIR POV: SHOOTING OUT THE WINDOW in to the alley just outside between the side of the church and the side of a crumbling brownstone apartment building next door -- FOUR STREET PEOPLE stand in shadows watching the church...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: A friend of mine at UCLA did a. study of chronic schizophrenics. They're supposed to have stereo- typed routines they repeat every 20 minutes or so -- like a stuck record in their brains repeating one phrase over and over... I've been watching them on and off all day -- and they don't seem to be making any movements. They just .stand there. .

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: One Christmas I tried to give this old guy a hot meal. He wouldn't come into my apartment, but he told me his grandfather had put a steak knife through the left side of his head when he was 5 -- and the right side of his head.was possessed by his mother, who wanted to have sex with him. With those kinds of problems, I say let ‘em stand there if they want to... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Walter notices Kelly rubbing her arm...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yeah -- I banged into something this afternoon... We see Kelly's arm, where a purple splotch like a faint bruise is beginning to show...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It's starting to hurt...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Probably nerves.

dialogues.speaker: . KELLY
dialogues.text: It's a bruise, Walter. You don't bruise from nerves.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I used to break out when I was 12. Doctor said it was homosexual panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: computer screen, a simulation. The liquid inside the canister is radiant, glowing in weird, alien colors. Swirling around the canister is an accretion disc, an inwardly-bound vortex of energy. Spreading outward from the edge of this disc are simulated beams of energy... FULL .SHOT: Dirac stands behind Catherine at the computer terminal, staring at the screen...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I made this model from the Latin equations... She shows him a sheet of figures. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 30.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: It's feeding off ‘virtual' particles -- capturing them somehow before they vanish -- splitting them apart...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Drawing energy and emitting force. Gradually building strength. Living off nothing. But now a faint, muffled CLICKING makes them turn... THEIR POV: the window. A shade has been drawn, but we can still hear the psychotic aad of all those moths outside. Silhouetted on the shade by streetlights are their wriggling, chaotic Shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group consisting of Wyndham, Calder and Lomax are huddled together talking m.o.s. just inside the sanctuary Brian exits, starts to the stairs, stops as Dirac comes UD...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: can I talk to you a minute? (beat) Look -- nobody's saying much of anything... We're still putting together the first rounds of tests and nobody's really stopped since we got here...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Nothing anywhere ever is supposed to be able to do what it's doing.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: (quietly) Settle down, now. Back to work... (CONTINUED)
oN

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: A life-form is growing out of pre-biotic fluid. It's not winding down into disorder -- it's self-organizing, becoming something. What? An animal? A disease?

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: We have no control over what we're uncovering. We're witnesses at a birth...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I want to know what you think it is.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: (reaches in his pocket) The hardest thing for any of us to hear is something we don't agree with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Brian a crumpled piece of computer paper. Brian unfolds it, reads...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (reading) “I saw a star fall from heaven unto the bottomless pit... And he was cast out, as water from a flood..." This is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: It's beyond the power of physical science to predict -- the closest thing we've found to a supernatural agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Susan the radiologist steps into the underground churc She's transfixed by the sight of the canister o.s. as Mullins comes up from inside the church...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: e@ Man... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Hadn't you seen it yet?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: For the last four hours I've been carbon dating the corrosion on the lid there. We're talking about seven million years...

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: What? * Mullins glances back at the canister... THEIR POV: the canister, as seen from the rear of the und ground church. The liquid inside seems to be glowing brighter now, almost bubbling -- churning with life...

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: I'm going topside. He starts out of the church, stops when he realizes Susan is just standing there staring at the canister...

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: You want me to wait for you?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No. Go on. Mullins walks out... SUSAN'S POV: the canister. Now we hear the faintest sound the PATTER of water dripping on a hard surface... once. Silence. Again. ~ Susan, as she strains to hear...
at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Mullins walks out of the strange hallway into the dank corridor, away from CAMERA... Maybe it was his x footsteps we heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan -- listening... HER POV: the canister, from an ANGLE at the back of the church. That DRIPPING sound again... SMASH CUT: EXTREME CLOSE SHOT of the top of the canister. Suddenly a single drop of liquid flies upward against gra Beat. Then the quiet WET POP as it hits the ceiling o.s. Beat. And then another drop escapes, leaps upward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirac, the priest, Brian and Wyndham are seated around a table filled with computer pages that are taped together and spread out on one side, while photo copies of the old book of Latin are on the other. Lisa stands indicating various parts of the original text...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: This whole section is a kind of history. Part of it was indecipherable, as if someone were deliberately trying to erase it... but I managed to piece together most of it... Walter and Calder now drift into the room...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay --.it kind of starts here. The container was buried some- where in the Middle East, eons ago, by -~ it gets a little wild here -- the Father of Satan, a God who had once. walked the earth before man but was somehow banished to the darkside... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now Catherine and Kelly enter the room. Brian looks over at her, she at him.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Apparently the Father buried his son inside the container. This was the section that someone was trying to erase... Now, later on here, Christ comes to warn us. He was of extra- terrestrial ancestry -- but a human-like race...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Susan comes up right in front of the canister. She stares at it, listening intently... SUSAN'S POV: weirdly convulsing liquesence inside. Mold and corrosion around the top. HOLD. No drips. Nothing. Susan stands very still now in front of the thing, barely breathing, listening for that dripping sound again, when suddenly the machines in and around the canister slide away three e feet, as if i invisibly pu ‘pushed! Susan darts backward! She freezes again, just staring at the scientific equipment in their new positions. SUSAN'S POV: the top of the canister, as another drop suddenly shoots upward... CLOSE: Susan as she looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: as the drop hits a aitis pool that has collected i a srevice an in the ancien’ ant ceiling... HIGH; CLOSE-SHOT: LOOKING DOWN on Susan as she stares up. CLOSE: the pool of liquid, just hanging there, against gravity, the whole of it undulating slightly... HOLD. A beat. And then a THIN STREAM, A JET OF If BLASTS SUDDENLY

dialogues.speaker: DOWNWARD
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Susan's face, as she is splattered by the spray, m of it splashing into her mouth! WIDE SHOT: as Susan spins ‘around, spitting violently, COUGHING, furiously wiping the liquid off her face! She's a flailing figure clawing at her face, writhing there in front. of that glowing canister, ripping off her glasses which fall to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is here now, except Susan. Like a big meeting. Grim, sober faces. Lots of cigarettes, coffee. Everyone listens with rapt attention. Joining the group is DR. LEAHY, 50s, a chemistry professor...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: ++. and finally they determine Christ is crazy, but he's also gaining power, converting a lot of the people to his beliefs. So they kill him -- but his disciples keep the secret and hide it from civilization -- until man could develop a science sophisticated enough to prove what Christ was saying. A long pause. Walter leans over to Brian, whispers...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Something like this can really fuck up your weekend...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: How did the Roman Catholic Church keep this a secret for two thousand years? The priest looks terrible -- like he wants to die...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Apparently... a decision was made... to characterize pure * evil as a spirtual force. Evil within. .-The darkness in the hearts of men. It was more convenient. That way, man was * still the center of things... For a moment the priest's depression converts itself into a hard, cold anger...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: A stupid lie. We were salesmen, that's all. We soldour product, * to those who didn't have it. Reacting to the sound of his own voice, the priest stops for a beat, his voice lowering... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: The new life. Reward ourselves, punish our enemies. So we can live without truth. A substance. A malevolence, that was the truth. Asleep. Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FULL SHOT, the canister. Surrounded by equipment. We hear a RAGGED EXHALATION, a kind of shuddery BREATHING... * CAMERA. MOVES FORWARD, AROUND a piece of equipment -- to reveal Susan slumped down there, just sitting now like a rag doll, eyes staring, mouth open and moving silently li a fish drowning in the air. Now another WRENCHING, SPLATT ING COUGH escapes her lips -- almost a BARKING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the meeting starts to break up. A group has gathered around the priest, who sits defeatedly in b.g. In f.g. Brian stands over one of his own experiments -- a polygraph machine on atable with lots of wires dangling out of it. He's staring at the graph as Dirac comes over.

dialogues.speaker: . DIRAC
dialogues.text: Help me break this up. The others shouldn't hear this...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Faith is a hard thing to come by these days. Look at this a minute... That thing down * there just directed a fairly sizable burst of energy... Dirac looks at the readout...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Directed?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: In a straight line -- with the precision of less than a millisecond... As Walter comes up to them...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Everybody's acting like we should really be taking this seriously. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 37.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian and Dirac look up at him humorlessly...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You two aren't taking this seriously, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ANGLE: the canister. HOLD a beat, and then Susan slowl rises up INTO FRAME in f.g. She stands motionless, starin up at the canister. CLOSE: Susan. She has a weird, blank, neutral expression on her face. Eyes are flat -- like a bird's or tiger's eyes. It's the humanity that's gone -- replaced by someth else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group walks somberly out of the sanctuary into the hall. Some are quiet, moody. Wyndham in particular is derisive, dismissive. A kind of stupor prevails over most, however. Walter comes out, catches up with Lisa carrying her papers and notes back to her cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I think most of these huckle- berries are buying this shit. But Lisa only gives him a venomous stare of contempt for his attitude and moves off without saying a word, as Kell comes walking by Walter now. She's still rubbing that bruise on her arm...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Still don't get it, do you Walter?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: A good life means a clean colon, that's all I need to know. But Kelly's moved on too...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: This is somebody's idea of a practical joke, you know that, don't you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No response...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We go to sleep, I guarantee you there'll be a rubber chicken in the bed, know what I mean? But now he's completely alone with his attitude...
Dirac and Brian, looking at the familiar wavy lines of th polygraph...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: A few minutes ago a vibration was triggered in the metal on that thing downstairs -- a strong one... Dirac studies the wavy lines closer...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Some kind of kinetic emission came out of it. Now if it can transmit a signal strong enough...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: It could move other objects. Instantaneously, across a distance...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Without outside intervention.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Psychokinesis.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Mind-directed energy. It's been documented before, observed in psychiatric clinics.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Usually as a result of rage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They stare at each other...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Don't tell the others yet.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Why not? They have a right to know this -- it's conscious!

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Not until you prove it wasn't something else -~ a power surge, a draft of air... Dirac looks at him evenly, calmly. Finally Brian relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Catherine plops down in her chair. Kelly stands at the door, rubbing her arm...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to do? Just go back to work...?

dialogues.text: I thought I was a normal girl -- soft of. A went to school, I ate breakfast, I used a diaphram -- so why is this happening to me?

dialogues.text: Some kind of power. Directed outward. A controlled force...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What is it doing?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Reaching out. Influencing, changing things. Moving objects by thought. This stuns Catherine. She just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: We all win Nobel Prizes. The extraordinary intervention. An intelligent cause -- other than man...

dialogues.text: as Mullins comes inside. His flashlight beam spins about eerily... HIS. POV: the church. In b.g. is the canister. Silence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirac and the priest. Alone now. The priest looks completely exhausted. But Dirac looks strong, somehow.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Suppose what your faith has said was essentially correct... The priest looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Suppose you have a universal mind controlling everything -- a God willing the behavior of every subatomic particle. Any individual particle still appears to be random, mind you -=- but if you look at the collective behavior of vast numbers of atoms -- then you see organization.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: A search for order. Isn't that what we want to find? A structure. To prove we're in benevolent hands... Dirac picks up a thick, bound stack of computer-printed pages: the translation. He opens it to a marked page...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: This diety, the Father of Satan... The literal trans- lation from Latin is 'Anti- God'... (closes the page) Every particle has an anti- particle, its mirror image, its negative. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo 4

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dirac leans back in his chair. His eyes go to a small shaving mirror on his desk. He touches the surface of the mirror with his finger...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: We've been collecting anti- matter for years -- in magnetic bottles. It's not even a romantic idea to us anymore... He looks up at the priest... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Maybe this universal mind lives in the mirror-image -- instead of in our universe, as we've always wanted to believe. Maybe he's Anti-God -- bringing darkness instead of light... The priest looks up suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VS As the priest turns back to Dirac... *

dialogues.text: This priest is a real case, man. He's looney tunes. And I'm'beginning to wonder about Dirac...

A FLASH as the figure passes CAMERA -- tattered, frenzied her eyes wild, it is the Bag Lady we saw earlier, and as she passes she pulls out an evil-looking metal shiv!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes up to Wyndham, raises the shiv, plunges it int his shoulder! QUICK, FRENZIED FLASHES, allowing us not to see the actua blade impacts, only a violent visual suggestion -- as the Bag Lady lifts the shiv and plunges it again and again, into the back of his neck, his shoulders -- a wild paroxy of slashing fury! CLOSE: the window, as Susan watches silently, emotion- lessly... CLOSE, QUICK CUTS: Wyndham tries to fend off the blows, but he's weakening. He is slashed all over... WIDE SHOT: Wyndham finally falls down to the sidewalk. Th Bag Lady steps back from him now as he crawls slowly alon the grass, barely pulling himself forward, and finally ro into some bushes. HOLD THE SHOT. The Street People are like statues. The Bag Lady walks slowly back to them. Now the bushes stop moving. It's quiet now. Wind WHISHING in the alley.
