dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIS POV: Susan, as she comes toward him -- blank face. Emotionless eyes. Calder, as Lisa springs INTO FRAME behind him, locks her arm around his throat! She pulls his head back, opening his mouth... Susan, as she keeps moving toward him... Calder, flailing helplessly in Lisa's grip, a CHOKED GURG coming out of his mouth... Calder's hand, as it BANGS into Lisa's computer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Catherine looks up from a drawing she's making, thinki maybe she just heard something distantly -- as Brian step into the room...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Hear what? They listen. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lomax, Walter and Leahy have started the meeting. Walter remains contemptuous of the seriousness around him.

dialogues.speaker: LEAHY
dialogues.text: This whole place is going to have to be encased in concrete.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No way, a building this size... I say we launch the fucker into space...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: (looking up) I'm hearing something... * They listen. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa holds Calder's head back, as Susan leans in to his face... Her hand touches his cheek -- gently, a lover's touch. Now she leans in closer, and her mouth covers his! CLOSE: Calder and Susan, as if they were joined in the most passionate of kisses. As Susan pulls away slightly, we see a JET OF LIQUID SPEW OUT OF HER MOUTH INTO HIS...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Catherine. She sits stiffly as he massages her neck and shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't I know how to show a girl a great time? Stick with me, I'll shower you with romantic weekends like this one. It doesn't get the response he had hoped for. Catherine has retreated into herself.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I'm starting to feel like I have to start running soon... Just get away...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: From me?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: From anyone. BRIAN . I was hoping to not just be anyone.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You aren't. That scares me too. Brian stands her up, takes her in his arms...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe when this is all over we can just go someplace -- where the sun is warmer -- for a little while... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I don't think it'll ever be over... Catherine snuggles in closer to his arms... *

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: There's a meeting. People are starting to talk about jumping ship.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: And how about us? Brian doesn't answer, but from his face it's clear they * aren't leaving.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I didn't think so. She moves away from him, takes a piece of paper from the desk and holds up a drawing she has made.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Have you seen this figure before? THE DRAWING: a crude rendering of the figure on Kelly's a

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I have -- but I'm not sure where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" = 4/25/87 60.

dialogues.speaker: LEAHY
dialogues.text: We'd better figure out who to notify first...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Easy. Department of Health Services. “Hey, guys, guess what we've got coming to life over here?" "Okay, we'll have a man out there next Tuesday..."

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: You're not ever going to take this seriously, are you? As Brian and Catherine enter the lab...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sure, as soon as it starts taking me seriously...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Where's Dirac?

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: (beat) We didn't tell him.

dialogues.speaker: LEAHY
dialogues.text: We thought it might be better if we left him out of it...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: And the priest...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Why? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to get Dirac.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: I'm here. As Dirac and the priest enter. The priest carries a copy of the Roman Ritual... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beat, as 61.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: We think they left...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Kelly's asleep, I didn't... Dirac stares at the faces in the room...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: I'm asking you to stay. The work we do in the next 48 hours is critical. How many of you have fallen asleep tonight? (no reply) Come on... Lomax, Calder and Walter acknowledge that they have... From their

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: You dreamed about the front of this church, about a dark figure coming out. reactions to this, it's clear that they did.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: But didn't you feel it? Not like a dream. Something else. Puzzled looks from the room, as Dirac hands Brian a sheet of figures. Brian looks them over...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: I had the dream too, this image that didn't seem to be a part of my subconscious -- almost as if I were watching something that had been... prerecorded...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (staring at Dirac's figures) Tachyons?

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: One possibility. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oe 116 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (as he hands the sheet of figures to Catherine) Greek word. Means 'swift one'.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: So what is the dream? Precognition? Previous knowledge of a future event? A shared vision -- of something that has yet to occur.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Caused by that thing downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Perhaps not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tachyon is a subatomic particle that travels faster than light.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: And what if it's not a dream? What if it's a message? Brian crosses to a table -- pulls out that deck of cards. He's deep in thought -- as Catherine hands the sheet of ‘ 1 figures to Walter...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: What if these dreams, pre- monitions, omens -- what if they're really visual messages sent by human beings? Photo- graphs, video signals...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: From where?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: The future. Anything traveling faster than light would appear to be going backward in time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo,

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: A future scientist calculates the exact spot the earth occupied in space -- in the past, based on speed, trajectory... He beams a tachyon signal at that spot, transmits video information backward in time...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: ++. For us to receive as electrical impulses -- neural stimulus...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: {looking at the figures) Man oh man...

dialogues.speaker: LEAHY
dialogues.text: For what purpose?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Could be to warn us -- to show us what's coming. A remote camera view of the future -- so we can change it. And suddenly Brian performs the card trick perfectly. The card disappears...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Someone finally showed up to tell us -- it's time to stand up for what we are. Walter turns ‘to one of the monitoring devices nearby, as makes a soft BEEPING... He stares at the readout, taps it a couple times.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I think there's something wrong with this, I'm not getting anything now... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lomax goes over to another readout...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: Everything's dead. Dirac, Leahy and Brian quickly. check machines. Catherine taps at the power button on a computer...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (indicating the overhead light) Building power's still on... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 65.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Maybe the generators failed...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: Looks more like the units down- stairs have been cut off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA'S MOVING DOWN the center aisle, past crosses, IN TOWARD the apse, and we see that the canister is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES BEHIND Lisa and Susan as they walk through the shadows. NOW CAMERA MOVES DOWN to reveal they are carrying the canister between them, and the top is unscrewing ig itself, a vaporous steam escaping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the window, as a strange BUZZING VOICE is heard...

dialogues.speaker: WYNDHAM
dialogues.text: (v.o.) Hello-- Catherine turns to the window, frowning...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I heard a voice... The others. stop, as Catherine walks over to the window, looks out, down... HER POV: down below, standing in the alley by the side of the church, .is’ Wyndham!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: It's Wyndham... Brian comes over. Looks. As the others start drifting over...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: {calls out) Wyndham! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THEIR POV: Wyndham standing down there. CLOSER SHOT: Wyndham. He looks strange. Like his head has been stuck on top of a straw body. He doesn't look solid somehow... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: . CLOSER YET: Wyndham. His face is segmented. Tiny little lines, cracks, edges all over his flesh. His eyes are strange -- they are black, and have a chitinous sheen. As he opens his mouth to speak, we see he has no teeth. His voice BUZZES, DISTORTED, HOLLOW -- the words juttering ou like the beating of insect wings...

dialogues.speaker: WYNDHAM
dialogues.text: (distorted) I've-got-a-message-for-you. And-you' re-not-going-to-like- it...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Look at his chest... CLOSE: Wyndham's chest, as his jacket blows open, and we his entire chest cavity is filled with crawling beetles! CLOSE: Wyndham...

dialogues.speaker: WYNDHAM
dialogues.text: (distorted) Pray-for-death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Wyndham's hand, as it suddenly falls off and beetl pour down out of his jacket sleeve... CLOSE: his foot, as the pants legs sag and more beetles f out around the cuff, over his shoes... INSIDE THE SANCTUARY: as our group stares in total horror FULL..SHOT: Wyndham, the ‘bug. man, as he collapses now, disintegrates, revealing that he was nothing more than an imitation, a mimicry of a human being created by the beet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER: now he's nothing more than empty clothes, beetles scampering away by the thousands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Walter rushes out of the lab, totally unhinged, slows, stops, stares o.s. as Dirac comes out, the others... THEIR POV: Calder is moving slowly up the stairs, staring at them, dragging an old wooden chair behind him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The group...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Calder... CLOSE: Calder. Something wrong with his expression. He's perspiring heavily... CLOSE: the chair legs as they SCREECH along the floor to stop... CLOSE: the chair back, as Calder's hands paw, rip at the FULL SHOT: a tableau. The group watches Calder as he gras the piece of wood in his right hand... CLOSE: Calder. He brings the jagged piece of wood to one side of his throat, and without a change of @ expression begins to Oo rip it across toward the other Side! OVER CALDER, on the group, as he completes the slitting o his throat, falls heavily to the floor as the group react in horror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Kelly. Asleep. The sounds of SHOUTS and the PANDEMONIUM from the distant hallway upstairs barely register on her unconscious. CAMERA CRANES UP, and we see Lisa and Susan behind her. J inside the door. Coming over. Set ting the the canister d on the floor silently. Now Susan turns back to the door, quietly closes it... CLOSE: the canister. That steam continues to rise from the lid which is slowly loosening itself. PULL BACK to see Susan and Lisa kneel down on either side of it. CLOSE: Kelly, deep asleep, that bruise on her arm vivid n CLOSE: Susan and Lisa, their faces blank, staring into th dark, steam rising between them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and the priest kneel over Calder. He's just lying there, barely hanging on to life, his eyes glassy, his ripped throat mercifully hidden by a towel...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Ego te absolve in nomine Patris... The priest stares fixedly -- he can't complete the Last Rites... Catherine looks at him -- his faith is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Dirac and Leahy rush up to the rear doors, try to open them, pushing with all their might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see tht the rear doors have been barricaded! old pieces of steel and wood are wedged across the doorknobs. Shopping carts are piled up. All bits of odds and ends have been jammed up against the doors... The Street People watch silently from the alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest, shaken, holding the Roman Ritual, stares down as Catherine kneels over Calder. She feels his pulse, listens for a heartbeat. Then she looks back up at the priest, shaking her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bizarre barricade of broken appliances, ropes, ro and. other debris CREAKS and flexes as the door is pushed outward... but doesn't give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Brian and Lomax push on the doors. There's no way anyone's getting out. CAMERA MOVES WITH Brian over to a crack in the wall. He looks out... HIS POV: the front of the church. 10 Street People stand outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" = 4/25/87 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Walter comes hauling ass down the hall, checking rooms the lounge, Lisa's cubicle, avoiding the iron door, an empty storeroom -- and finally the Women's Sleeping Quart The door is closed. Walter waits for a beat, opens it, looks in... SHOOTING FROM INSIDE: Walter silhouetted in the threshold staring into the totally dark room...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks, can't see anything. Then he leans over and trie the light switch. Doesn't work. Out of his pants pocket h quickly pulls a flashlight, clicks it. on. He points it u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV: the broken light bulb in the ceiling, liguid rus all around it! Walter. He reacts, takes a couple steps into the room. HIS POV: the flashlight beam hits the outline of a single figure, a woman, kneeling on the floor. WALTER, as he takes a couple steps forward, CAMERA MOVING WITH HIM... HIS POV: TRACKING IN TOWARD the kneeling figure. The flas light beam plays across her back. It is Susan. Her shoulders are slumped, her head bowed, almost as if she is praying. Now the flashlight beam illuminates something in front of her, rising from a source hidden by her body, a ‘a THIN ‘STREAM 0! OF LIQUID -- ==" FALLING UPWARD! CLOSE: Walter, MOVING A LITTLE CLOSER... HIS POV: TRACKING IN on Susan, coming up behind her, seei to the canister in front of her POURING A SPOUT OF FLUID TOWARD THE CEILING. The top is still attached -- barely. CLOSE: Walter, as he moves his flashlight beam up... * HIS POV: CLOSE, PANNING UP the stream of liquid as it ris CLOSE: Walter, as he looks higher... HIS POV: PANNING UP to see the liquid spreading out acros the ceiling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MEDIUM SHOT: Walter, looking up, speechless, stunned -- as Susan LEAPS INTO FRAME right in front of him, hitting him, knocking him down! LOW ANGLE as Walter and Susan go tumbling, rolling across the floor. She's insane, wild, like a junkie on TCP -- clawing and digging at him like a cat -- but with that we blank expression all the while. Finally Walter manages to break away from her... CLOSE: as Walter crawls away, across the floor, backs int awall... He's lost his flashlight. OUTSIDE IN THE REAR HALLWAY: as Brian comes running up fr one direction, Dirac and Leahy from the other...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: The back doors are blocked!

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Same thing up front... INSIDE THE SLEEPING QUARTERS: as Walter hears the voices outside, picks himself up, stumbles against the wall...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Dirac! Brian! OUTSIDE IN THE HALL: Brian, Dirac and Leahy hear this, move in to the door of the sleeping quarters...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's in here! Don't come in! They stop at the threshold... INSIDE THE. SLEEPING QUARTERS: Walter looks into the dark ness of the room. It's quiet inside now. Dark. Just that quiet BUBBLING of the liquid... WALTER'S POV: his flashlight on the floor. CLOSE: Walter, as he moves for the flashlight... CLOSE: the flashlight, as Walter snatches it up... Walter, as he shines the beam up... HIS POV: the flashlight beam swings on to the pool of

dialogues.speaker: DOWNWARD
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian, Dirac and Leahy stare in from the doorway... Walter, as he swings the flashlight beam down... HIS POV: Kelly, lying on the cot, the STREAM OF LIQUID

dialogues.speaker: LITERALLY FORCING ITS WAY INTO HER
dialogues.text: FULL SHOT: Walter, staring at Kelly...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Kelly! * As Susan leaps suddenly into the beam of his flashlight, right for him! OVER SUSAN: on Walter, as he ducks, and Susan sails past A COT, as Walter stumbles over it, assholing himself back down to the floor... Walter, as he comes to a stop, the flashlight still in hi hand... THE DOORWAY, as Leahy suddenly steps in with a flashlight

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Get back! Leahy stops, turns his flashlight into a dark corner next to him. Lisa is standing there! She suddenly leaps right for him out of the dark, lands on top of him, pulling him out into... THE HALLWAY, as .Leahy.and Lisa go sprawling across. the Brian‘‘and Dirac spin around from the doorway... INSIDE THE SLEEPING QUARTERS, as Walter stands up, turns around, his flashlight beam catching Susan right behind him, moving for him! OVER SUSAN, on Walter as he swings his flashlight hard, connecting with the side of her head, knocking her away! Susan, as she goes SLAMMING to the floor! IN THE HALL: suddenly Lisa swings UP INTO FRAME! It's a LOW ANGLE, and she's on top of... Leahy. Her hands move across his face, her fingers over his eyes, pushing, trying to punch his‘eyes out! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: UP ANGLE: Lisa, as Brian grabs her from behind, around th waist, and pulls her up and off Leahy... Suddenly she opens her mouth and sprays liquid... CLOSE: Leahy, as the liguid splashes into his mouth! He reacts as if he's suddenly swallowed acid, grabbing his throat, CHOKING deep in his throat... Brian, as he spins Lisa around, holding her in a bear hug ANOTHER ANGLE: as Lisa suddenly, forcefully breaks free! WIDE SHOT: the hall, as Brian backs away from her. Leahy is gasping for breath on the floor, as the others come up down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Stay back! Lisa stands her ground, looking at them with that emotion expression...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Walter! INSIDE THE SLEEPING QUARTERS: Walter spins around, his flashlight smearing the CAMERA LENS... HIS POV: Susan rises slowly from the floor. It looks as if her neck may be broken, but it doesn’t seem to have an effect on her. She stares at Walter with dead eyes, blood coming out of her nose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter backs away... His degs..back into a cot... And Walter stumbles slighlty... UP ANGLE: as Susan suddenly dives through the air for him Walter leaps out of the way as Susan comes CRASHING DOWN on the cot! LOW ANGLE, as Walter loses his balance, tumbles and rolls across the floor to a stop... CLOSE: Walter looks back... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIS POV: his flashlight beam illuminates Susan crawling across the floor, coming for him... Walter crawls frantically away... CLOSE: Susan's hands reach for Walter's feet, ripping at them as he pulls away... CLOSE: TRACKING WITH Walter as he pulls himself across the floor, looking up... HIS POV: ANGLE FROM FLOOR, SHOOTING UP, TRACKING IN on a storage closet door... SUSAN grabs Walter's ankle! Walter, as he reaches up... DOORKNOB, as Walter's hand grasps it... WALTER'S FOOT, slipping out of Susan's grip... Walter, opening the door... Susan, raking Walter's legs, trying to get a grip... Walter rolls into the storage closet, SLAMS THE DOOR SHUT IN THE HALLWAY: Brian has joined Catherine, Dirac, Lomax. The priest is down the hall -- Lisa stands her ground by the door to the sleeping quarters, like some inhuman guar

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: Not CLOSE: the priest, as he looks behind him. Walking slowly down the hall toward them is Calder! CLOSE: CALDER. He is completely and totally dead, but he' coming for them, eyes open, staring at them lifelessly! T towel's still hanging there on his throat, stuck to his ripped flesh by the blood... The priest, staring at Calder in horror... Catherine, turns, looks back the other way... HER POV: past Lisa, down the hallway -- the iron door, as Mullins slowly steps out into the hall! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Mullins, also very much dead, also very much walki and staring and starting down the hall for them! The priest backs away from Calder, ducks into an empty storeroom... INSIDE THE STOREROOM: the priest closes the door with a SLAM! Locks it -- an old dead bolt... IN THE HALLWAY: as Brian, Catherine, Dirac and Lomax quic back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the lounge. Dirac immediately closes the door behind them...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Block the door! They begin moving tables, chairs, couches, anything they can find, up against the door as a barricade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest listens at the door. Silence. He turns, looks into the empty storeroom. Not much here. A large mirror on one wall. Some old metal lockers. An old boiler in one corner of the room -- it's pretty large Next to it is an old tarpaulin stacked up against the wal Terrified, the priest hurries over, crawls down behind the boiler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Just the occasional LURPING of liquid o.s., as CAMERA SLOWLY TRACKS IN on the storage closet door... INSIDE THE STORAGE CLOSET: Walter and his flashlight in the tiny closet. He's listening at the door. Now he looks out a screen decorative grill... WALTER'S POV THROUGH GRILL: the sleeping quarters. Dark. Empty. THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter. He lifts his flashlight to the grill... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WALTER'S POV: Kelly. Lying on the cot. Her stomach is huge, as if she's suddenly become | very pregnant == swol from the ‘amount unt of liguid inside | her! The flashlig moves up and down her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter, staring out... CLOSE: Kelly's face, and we see a thin trickle of liguid slide up from her cheek and disappear into her lips! THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter. Now he hears a CLUNK, looks over... WALTER'S POV: door to the hall, as Lisa steps into the doorway, silhouetted there! INSIDE THE STORAGE CLOSET: Walter clicks off the flash- light. He stands watching through the grill... WALTER'S POV: Lisa moves into the room. She looks over at the storage closet door, at Walter peering out through the grill, then stops. Stares at him. THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead quiet. The door has been barricaded with every piece of furniture in the room. Brian, Catherine, Lomax and Dirac stand very still, listening. No sounds come from the hallway outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest, hiding behind that huge boiler, listening now eyes moving. Nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT: Leahy, lying on the floor, mouth open... Now suddenly his eyes shoot open -- and the spark behind them is not his...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Shhh... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They listen again. Nothing. Silence. CATHERINE. Sun's coming up... They look over. There's a soft blue glow at the window. Dirac goes over quietly, looks out... DIRAC'S POV: the sun just edges over the horizon. CLOSE: Dirac looks over to his left... DIRAC'S POV: standing there a few yards away are 15 Stree People, motionless, staring back, mute guardians... CLOSE: Dirac looks to his right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up now. Traffic moves on the street normally. Nothing to suggest anything is wrong inside the massive abandoned church -=- except maybe for the occasio Street Person shuffling by in front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the storage closet, Walter peers silently through the grill... HIS POV: Now Susan and Lisa both stand a few feet away, staring back at him, standing guard. THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter glances over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV: Kelly unconscious on the cot. Her stomach swolle THROUGH THE GRILL: as Walter looks back over now... HIS POV: Susan and Lisa, just standing there...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Normally I love being dominated by women... They don't move a muscle -- barely breathe... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: om

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Lisa... I'm sorry about what I said before. You don't look Asian at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catherine leans up against one wall...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I thought I heard Walter. The others come over, listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes stock. He has a flashlight. He looks around. The closet is empty. Should he try going out and fighting his way through? He looks out again through the grill... HIS POV: Kelly. We notice some changes in her face -- . subtle, but unmistakable. Her skin has coarsened. There are dark circles under her eyes. Her lips are dry, cracke INSIDE THE CLOSET: as Walter hears a FAINT KNOCKING at the rear wall. He cautiously moves over, bends down, listens...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (distantly) Walter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side, Catherine knocks on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Walter! And now, very faintly, we hear...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (distantly) What the fuck do you want?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: If I told you, you wouldn't believe me... He feels the wall...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Hey, can you dig through and get me out of here?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (distantly) I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: «+. the wall's too thick.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Well, that's a relative thing right now, but yeah -- (he looks over) Wait a second... He goes back over to the grill, looks out, comes back to the wall...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: ‘They're just standing. there outside. Not trying to get in. They've stopped attacking for some reason...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I'm in this closet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine breaks a table brace off one of the pieces of furniture in the barricade, comes over to the wall... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I can dig through with this. It'll take awhile... Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, listening...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (distantly) We're going to try to dig through.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How long will that take?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (distantly) Hours.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh, great. I tell you what, I'll hang out here anyway... He gets up from the wall, goes back to the grill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest, behind the boiler. He's still clutching the Roman Ritual. HIS POV: from behind the boiler, we see the door across the room... Suddenly it SLAMS WITH A CRASHING SOUND! A be ANOTHER CRASH AND THE DOOR SWINGS OPEN! Calder steps into the room! He stops, looks around. CLOSE: the ‘priest, staring, barely breathing, making him as small as possible... HIS POV: Calder, as he sees the huge mirror on the wall. He turns, faces the mirror. CLOSE: Calder, staring... OVER CALDER: the mirror, Calder's image reflected there, as he stares into it, hypnotized, almost as if he sees something we don't see... He, too, has become a mute guardian -- of the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the lounge window swings open. Brian and Lomax lean ou (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THEIR POV: down one direction, 15 Street People... Brian and Lomax look the other way... THEIR POV: the other direction -- 10 more Street People..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stands by the window. Brian swings his legs out over the sill...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Get ready to pull me back Up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Brian slips out, drops from the window, and lands on the ground some ten feet below. HIS POV: the 15 Street People begin moving toward himi No we see they have sticks, boards, broken bottles in their hands! Brian looks the other direction... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIS POV: the 10 Street People are closing in from this direction, weapons in their hands! For a moment Brian almost decides to try it. He looks at the huge stone wall in front of him. Too high to climb. And there's too many of them -- so Brian turns back to th window and jumps up for the sill... UP ANGLE: Lomax, Dirac and Catherine in the window, reach down for him... LOOKING DOWN FROM WINDOW: as Brian leaps for their hands! CAMERA MOVES BACK WITH the 15 Street People closing in... THEIR POV: TRACKING IN TOWARD Brian as he leaps for the window, the other group of 10 Street People coming closer UP ANGLE: as Catherine leans way out...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Brian! LOOKING DOWN FROM WINDOW: Brian leaps with all his might! CLOSE: Brian's hand grabs Catherine's! CAMERA MOVES BACK WITH the 10 Street People... THEIR POV: TRACKING IN on Brian as Dirac and Lomax also g his hands, COMING RIGHT UP ON HIM, as does the other grou of 15, as Brian is pulled up into the window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Brian.is, pulled inside. Dirac looks down... DIRAC'S POV: LOOKING DOWN at the huge mass of Street Peop standing 10 feet below, staring up, motionless now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is mid-sky..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, still leaning against the door looking out throug the grill... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WALTER'S POV: Susan and Lisa are still standing in’ the exact same positions watching him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You guys see any movies you like? They just stare back. THROUGH THE GRILL: as Walter looks over... HIS POV: Kelly, lying on the cot. She's motionless, excep for her chest rising and falling grotesquely, as if her whole rib cage were expanding beyond its limit. A hollow, ragged EXHALATION comes from her mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A continuation of that strange dream, the VIDEO POV FROM THE FUTURE. We move closer and closer to that dark figure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Catherine wakes up from the dream. Startled. She's sitting down, leaning against the wall of the lounge. She looks over... HER POV: Lomax is digging at the wall with the leg brace. He's just barely making progress chipping away there... CLOSE: Catherine, as she looks over... HER POV: Dirac and Brian talking together...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: We can try the hallway after it gets dark. If I can get around to the front, we can break windows, call for help...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: No one out there can help us. Dirac gets up, walks to the window. Brian stares after hi Catherine, watching Brian for a beat, gets up, comes over to him, kneels down. She gently touches his face...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: The other morning you said you had something to tell me... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mo

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She reaches out with her finger, traces an invisible line around his lips...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: And you probably think none of that matters right now... But you're wrong. It's the only thing that does... She kisses him gently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the priest behind the boiler, looking out... HIS POV: from behind the boiler, we see Calder standing there across the room, still staring at the mirror on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter looks out... HIS POV: Kelly. She's in half-light from the window. We see more changes on her face, as if she's slowly rotting away! The swelling in her abdomen has gone down so that her lower body almost looks back to normal. She opens her mouth, EXHALES A DEEP RASP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the sun sinks lower in the afternoon sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine ‘sits. near the window glowing with light from setting sun. She looks tired, worn. Lomax is nearby, huddled in the corner, asleep. Dirac's leaning against a wall. Brian digs away at the wall with the leg brace. Finally he stops , sags against the wall in exhaustion. He looks over... Dirac. The light from the setting sun makes a soft, luminous glow on his face. He's looking at the window... HIS POV: the window sill, as a line of ants crawls madly along...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Worker ants, driven to a higher purpose -- unknown to the individual. The street people, our collegues -- all controlled...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Demonic possession...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Of a kind... Not what we would expect, though. Never that.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why would he need us? The book says his purpose is to bring the Father back from the darkside, wherever that is.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: There could be a limit to what he can do -- as just a volume of liquid. He controls simple organisms easily. But maybe he needs something more complex to complete a life cycle... A host in which to live...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (distantly) Hello? Hello!

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (to the. wall) Walter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter kneels near the wall, whispering as loudly as he dares...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's Kelly. She's changing again...

dialogues.speaker: 163C
dialogues.text: REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Kelly. Back-lit by the light from the window. Her mouth is open in a kind of rictus. We see her strangely blackened teeth, her skin -- ragged and torn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Dirac has joined Brian and Catherine by the hole. The listen to Walter...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (distantly) The swelling's gone down, as if the liquid was absorbed into her system... I can see tissue changes on her face... Also I think her bone structure is changing...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Changing into what?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER -
dialogues.text: (distantly) I don't know, but you wouldn't want to take her to meet your parents...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s the only way he can actualize his power -~ a parasite growing into its host... This could be some kind of gestation period...

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I knew I'd seen it before! Kelly had a mark -- a bruise... Almost like a figure... I saw it in a history book. The astrologer's staff -- used in ritual magic in the middle ages.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: The mark was on her? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes. As if she was chosen...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Walter...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (distantly) What?

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Keep watching her. Closely. Anything you see... tell us.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (distantly) I have to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window, as the sun slips down below the horizon. The huge boiler, that tarpaulin plopped against the wall beside it. CAMERA MOVES IN, DOWN, to see the priest behind the boiler... CLOSE: the priest. He has the Roman Ritual open, and he's reading. He looks up... PRIEST'S POV: Calder, staring into that mirror... CLOSE: the priest. Now he begins to read the Roman Ritual aloud, but very, very softly. Whispering an exorcism...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: (whispers) God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ... CLOSE: Calder. Either he doesn't hear -- or doesn't recognize the words the priest speaks. He may hear them, but they have nothing to do with the will inside him that keeps him standing there staring at the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: (whispers) I appeal to your holy name, humbly begging your kindness that you may graciously grant us help against this unclean spirit...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the priest, as he glances up for a beat at Calder.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: «+» now tormenting these creatures of yours, through Christ our Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE STORAGE CLOSET: Walter stares through the grill... HIS POV: Kelly. Her face has changed further! In this half-light of dusk it's hard to see clearly, but we know clearly that Kelly is decomposing, disintegrating, changi into some unearthly t hing! THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter. It's getting darker, so he clicks on his flashlight, shines it through... HIS POV: Kelly, as the flashlight beam moves across Kelly's prone, motionless figure, up to her face -- and then Kelly slowly turns her head and looks over at Walter Susan and Lisa -- as they slowly turn their heads, look over at Kelly, as a cot near them suddenly slides across the floor on its own!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calder, as he turns away from the mirror, sensing that the thing inside Kelly is awake! CLOSE: the priest...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: God, Creator and defender of the human race, look down in pity on these, your servants, trapped in the coils of man's ancient enemy, sworn foe of our race...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASH: Kelly, as she looks over toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the boiler moves, of its own will! It slides, presses a aa tent? “inward, SCRAPING LOUDLY, crushing the priest's Pain shoots across his face.  167 168 169 170 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE GRILL: Walter, staring out in horror... AN EMPTY FRAME, and then Kelly slowly rises into it, sitting up, silhouetted by the last of the sunlight. She looks over at Walter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE STORAGE CLOSET: as Walter's flashlight flashes suddenly, sputters out! FULL SHOT: sleeping quarters. As all the cots in the room THROUGH THE GRILL: as Walter gives the loudest delivery of his life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they hear Walter's voice ECHOING THROUGH THE WALL, SCREAMING AND SHOUTING! Brian starts digging furiously at the hole in the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE STORAGE CLOSET: Walter is going crazy!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Get me the hell outta here!

dialogues.speaker: OUTA HERE
dialogues.text: WALTER'S POV: as Kelly gets up off the cot, stands erect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops digging, puts down the leg brace, gets up and rushes over to the door. He begins pulling down pieces of the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: Brian! In the distance, HEAR WALTER SCREAMING. Now Catherine takes over digging at the hole...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Lomax, get behind the door!

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Close the door once I'm in the hall...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: You can't...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No time... Brian hits the light switch, plunging the lounge into semi-darkness. Lomax moves over to the opposite side of the door. Dirac bends down by a table, pulls off one of its legs, tosses it to Brian. He pulls off another leg, tosses it to Lomax... Catherine gouges away at the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, at the door, looking out... HIS POV: Kelly walks up behind Susan and Lisa, staring in at Walter... The storage closet door, as it is hit by a psychokinetic BLAST: a huge je crack RIP: RIPS DOWN THE CENTER! INSIDE THE STORAGE CLOSET: Walter jumps back, rushes to the rear wall, begins frantically digging, slamming his fist into it...- IN THE SLEEPING QUARTERS: Susan and Lisa move forward to the storage closet, begin throwing their weight against the door, CRACKING IT further, SPLINTERING IT partially

dialogues.speaker: OPEN
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kelly, as something pulls her stare downward... KELLY'S POV: a purse on the floor, its contents spilled out. A small compact mirror lies there, reflecting moonli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catherine claws madly at the wall. Dirac looks around, sees a pair of chopsticks from an old box of Chinese food He grabs them, and a can of soda. He begins shaking the soda can wildly. The barricade is pulled off the door... Brian slowly turns the doorknob. Waits. Listens. Pulls the door open slightly, tries to stare through the tiny crack... WHAMMO! Mullins' arm shoots through the crack, grabs Brian around the neck! Brian brings the table leg down on the arm, hard! Mullins lets go, Brian jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door BLASTS INWARD! Susan and Lisa on the other side, try to crawl over it...! Walter desperately digs away at the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door to the lounge swings open, revealing Mullins standing there, silhouetted by the light from the hall! He steps into the room! A FLASH: as Dirac POPS THE TOP on the soda can! A spray o Coca-Cola... +++ jets into Mullins' face, as Lomax steps out from behi the door, swinging the table leg with all his might! CLOSE, OVER MULLINS, as the table leg connects with the back of his head, BLASTING HIM OUT OF FRAME! And Brian scrambles out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +... and into the hall, as the lounge door SLAMS SHUT BEH HIM, and suddenly Leahy steps INTO FRAME, GRABS HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine scraping at the wall, and suddenly a hole break through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hole in the wall is barely big enough, but Walter wildly pulls at the edges, making it wider... Now he sticks his arms through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. and Catherine pulls. Walter's head starts to come through... Mullins' form, moving around in the dark, being struck at from all sides by Dirac and Lomax -- a frenzied battle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian and Leahy grapple, Brian landing a hard SMACK with the table leg! Leahy's head is snapped back! But he holds on, pulling Brian down to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hole in the wall, as Walter madly scrambles through into the lounge, as Susan and Lisa's hands reach through right behind him, grabbing af after his feet! “Catherine at the hands with the leg brace, as Walter now grabs a chunk of the wall and beings pounding at their fingers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kelly stands up IN FRAME, now holding that compact mirror in her hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the mirror is rippling, like the surface of water no longer solid, but a glistening liquia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER MIRROR: on Kelly, as she moves her hand toward it... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Mirror, as two of Kelly's fingers touch the surfac pass through it into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full of liquid. Underwater. Almost totally black in here, except for a small square of light ~- the other sid of the mirror, as Kelly's fingers move through, into the DARKSIDE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER MULLINS, on Dirac, who darts forward and drives thos chopsticks into Mullins‘ neck! OVER DIRAC: WHAM! Mullins spins around, stares at Dirac, pulls out the chopsticks. CLOSE: Mullins, as he opens his mouth, a spray of liquid jetting out! Dirac, as he ducks out of the way... The wall, as the liquid splashes against it, drips down.. The floor, as it rushes across... Mullins' legs, as the liquid leaps up... CLOSE: Mullins. The liquid drizzles up into his mouth aga ANOTHER ANGLE: as Lomax springs up and grabs Mullins, sna an arm around Mullins' neck, pulling him backward...

dialogues.speaker: LOMAX
dialogues.text: Open the door! Dirac moves around them for the door... Susan and Lisa are forcing themselves in through the hole as Walter and Catherine continue beating at them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian throws off Leahy. Leahy comes up again, only to receive another SMACK from Brian's table leg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Dirac opens the door, and Lomax pulls Mullins out into the hall...

dialogues.text: 183 SIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +». right into Leahy! He grabs Lomax from behind! Lomax is suddenly caught between the two of them, as Mullins Slips free and turns around on Lomax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian races over, begins clubbing Leahy, pulls him away from Lomax... As Dirac comes out of the lounge into the hall... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lomax, as Mullins’ hands move to his face, his eyes... Dirac swings at Mullins, but Mullins knocks him back into the door, as Lomax SCREAMS o.s. -- and Dirac stares in horror... As Mullins drags Lomax SCREAMING down to the floor in a heap... As Brian, on the floor struggling with Leahy, begins POUNDING him furiously with the table leg, as we see Calder coming out of the empty storeroom just down the hall, turning, walking toward them... As Dirac. starts to go to help Lomax, when suddenly he is grabbed from behind by Susan and pulled back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where Walter and Catherine struggle with Lisa. She's scratching, swinging at them, but they get around behind her, move her to the window... As Dirac spins around, fighting Susan... As Walter and Catherine push Lisa out the window through the glass! 0

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: As Lisa falls in a shower of glass DOWN PAST FRAME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's face. Intent. Pushing hard. CLOSE: the mirror, as Kelly tries to force her hand furth through, into the liquid surface!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black.__Underwater. The small square of light, as Kelly's fingers probe in from our glowing world on the other side But her fingers are in as far as they will go --_the compact mirror is too small...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian crawls away from Leahy lying twisted and crumple on the floor, his head the center of a small pool of blood... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks up, as Calder comes up over him, reaching down! Brian rolls out of the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kelly pulls out her fingers, hurls the mirror down in a fury! . CLOSE: as the mirror, suddenly solid again, SMASHES on th floor! ~~ Kelly, in a rage, now looks over, starts for the door to the hall -- and we see that strange bruise on her arm is vivid now, an exact duplicate of the figure in the old _ Latin book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the priest, writhing in agony, the huge boiler sti crushing his leg, as he looks over... PRIEST'S POV: as Kelly walks slowly into the room! She stares over at that mirror hung on the wall, then looks at the priest... CLOSER: Kelly. It looks like a hideous smile on her face, as she opens her mouth. Black teeth. . CLOSE: the priest, as he pulls away, yanking at his leg, trying to free it... CLOSE: the priest's hands, as they grab on to the old tarpaulin and pull... CLOSE: the priest, as he manages to pull himself out from under the boiler and around behind it, away from Kelly. * CLOSE: Kelly, as she turns, staring over... * OVER KELLY: on the mirror, as it undulates, rippling, no longer glass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dirac, Catherine and Walter struggle with Susan, push her to the window, up and out through the broken glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian gets to his feet, gives Calder a HARD THWACK wit the table leg! Calder goes flying... Brian looks... BRIAN'S POV: Mullins stands up from Lomax's body, turns a stares at Brian... As Brian backs away... CLOSE: Leahy, as he moves his head, coming alive, looking up at Brian from that pool of blood... As Calder slowly gets to his feet... LONG LENS:. through Mullins' legs, as Lomax now sits up, his eyes gone now, gouged out, but coming back to life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Kelly, as she puts her arm up... OVER KELLY: on the liquid mirror, as she sticks her hand through it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A_large square of light in the underwater blackness. Now Kelly's hand reaches through, grasping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Kelly, pushing against some inter-dimensional forc her voice deep ‘and inhuman...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (distorted) Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Kelly's hand reaching through, pushing further i beckoning... CLOSE SHOT: something. A dark shape against underwater blackness. _But there's texture. Slime. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It_is a head. The skin moves. Crawls. As now its two eyes open,_as if awakening, and look over! It is the Father of Satan, the Anti-God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the priest yanks hard on the tarpaulin, pulling himself out from behind the boiler... As the tarpaulin falls down from the wall, revealing a fire ax inside a glass case!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian comes up to the door to the empty storeroom. Behind him Leahy is now on his feet -- Mullins, Lomax and Calder are coming. Brian looks in the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Kelly, sticking her hand further and further into the liquid mirror... The priest, as he hobbles to his feet and SMASHES the glass case... The doorway, as Brian dashes in, starts for Kelly... CLOSE: Kelly, suddenly sensing Brian... An old metal locker suddenly leaps up from the floor! OVER BRIAN, as the locker flies across the room and hits him with @ BANG, knocking him down OUT OF FRAME! Brian,:.as he hits the floor, the locker on top of him... CLOSE: Kelly, as she turns her head suddenly, SNARLS AT.. A FLASH OF THE PRIEST: as he raises the fire ax, brings it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FULL SHOT,_as Kelly's severed arm drifts leisurely into the -dark underwater dimension!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kelly turns from the mirror, and another arm suddenly spurts out -- growing out of her shoulder, replacing the severed lil limb! “Her face is a mask of rage and contemp The priest, as he swings the ax again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catherine climbs in through the hole in the wall, slowly goes to the open doorway, peers out. Walter comes through the hole behind her, followed by Dirac. Now Catherine steps into the sleeping quarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Kelly's severed head, back to us, lying on the flo as her hand reaches down, and grabs 1s the hair, lifting head yj up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest, staring... Brian, pushing off the locker, getting up... FULL SHOT: from behind Kelly, as she lifts the head right back on top of her body... CLOSE: Kelly, seating the head, grinning, eyes staring at the priest... Another locker comes spinning up suddenly off the floor.. And WHAM! It hits the priest, knocking him back... As Mullins, Leahy and Caldér suddenly spring into the roo behind Brian and grab him, pulling him violently over to the wall! As Lomax lurches in, blind, going for the pries CLOSE: Kelly, as she turns now... OVER KELLY: as she plunges her arm back into the liquid mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's arm. stretches out into the dark, as suddenly ano arm, _huge,_black, inhuman, rises up, the claws of the ha opening, reaching back for Kelly's handal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catherine emerges from the sleeping quarters, moves across the hall to the empty storeroom, followed by Walte and Dirac, as-a DEEP RUMBLING begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATHERINE'S POV: Brian trapped against the wall with Mull Leahy and Calder! He fights against them with all the strength he has left... Catherine, Walter and Dirac race into the room, over to help Brian. But that RUMBLING SOUND makes Catherine stop, turn to look... OVER KELLY: the liquid mirror, as Kelly pushes her arm deeper inside, the RUMBLING GROWING! The priest, trying to crawl to his feet out from under that locker, staring at Kelly as Lomax is almost on him..

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: NO! Please, God, help us! CLOSE: Kelly...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (distorted) Father... Come to freedom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's hand. Reaching. The huge clawed hand of the Anti- God reaching back. A black travesty of Michaelangelo's Sistine Chapel painting. Their fingers almost touching!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLING is deafening, as Catherine suddenly races forward... As Kelly senses her, turns... As Catherine leaps... Kelly, as Catherine grabs her, propelling them both forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catherine and Kelly float through the glowing square, Catherine's arms tight around Kelly, drifting out-into darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Brian, still entangled with Leahy, sees and

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMS
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the liquid mirror, as Catherine's feet disappear into the darkside! The priest, as he throws the ax past Lomax... The mirror, suddenly solid now, as the ax SMASHES INTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light from our world fragments, shatters, allowing us _a last glimpse of Catherine in the underwater dimensi before all goes black!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leahy, Calder, Lomax and Mullins suddenly collapse on the floor, leaving Walter and Dirac standing there. It is suddenly quiet in the room. Brian finally moves across th room, bends down, stares in pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN'S POV: the shattered mirror on the floor, Brian's face reflected in the shards... The priest, getting up now, staring... Dirac staring... , Walter, looking down... Mullins face, as liquid pours out of his mouth on to the floor... Dirac looks over... Leahy, liquid on the floor beside his mouth, begins to dissolve, steam issuing forth, evaporating... Calder, a vapor escaping from the liquid on the floor next to him... Lomax, the same... FULL SHOT of the room. Everyone motionless. Like statues.  Cp 213 214 215 216

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, lying on the concrete, steam evapomting like a soft cloud... Susan, lying nearby, the same...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: the ceiling, as that pool of liquid now mists away to nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Street People slowly scatter, drifting away in the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Walter leans out a window, looks down, jumps. He lands below, looks around. No Street People anywhere. He runs off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Walter comes running around to the front, hurrying to the street. He sees the very last of the Street People moving away. He quickly flags down a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dirac and Brian help the priest slowly down the hall..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cold blue light of dawn. Firetrucks. Squad cars. Paramedic ambulances. Walter, wrapped in a blanket, talks m.0.S. to a COP. Now the cop moves away, and Walter sees the green sheet-covered bodies of the others, the possess being wheeled away. He turns away, looks out into the nig shivering slightly under that blanket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest lies on a gurney. PARAMEDICS finish strapping him in. He glances over at Dirac. Dirac comes over, touches the priest's arm.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Maybe we've stopped it here. Maybe that future won't happen now... d 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE TRACKING WITH the priest on the gurney as he is wheeled toward the front... There is something about his face -- he's at peace now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stands there, staring at the Pile of shattered glas Dirac quietly enters, stands behind hin.

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: The smaller parts couldn't live without the strength of the whole -- they had to die, to fade away, as the whole was thrown back, repelled... We're safe. But he's waiting. On the other side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 222 223 224 225 228 REVISED - “PRINCE OF DARKNESS" - 4/25/87 101.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now Dirac moves up next to Brian...

dialogues.speaker: DIRAC
dialogues.text: She died for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: Brian in bed. His body bruised, his wounds bandaged. The room is filled with soft bars of sunlight and deep shadows. Brian sleeps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAND-HELD POV, the same as the other dreams, but as we move in toward the church we see Catherine emerging from the doors, into sunlight, coming toward us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAMMO! Brian wakes up. Startled. Disoriented. Eyes flicking around his small, decrepit bedroom. Turns on a light by the bed. Brian sits up. Slides out from under the covers. Sits on the edge of the bed. Can't believe he had the dream again He reaches over to the nightstand, picks up the telephone dials frantically... Now he looks over. BRIAN'S POV: a mirror on the door of his bedroom, no longer a mirror -- a liquid, swimming, rippling! CLOSE: Brian, staring in horror. As he talks into the telephone, we see a shape in b.g. rise INTO FRAME! It is Catherine! Out of focus, but we can still see she's decomposed just like Kelly. She walks toward him...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Dirac -~ the dream's back! -But it's "Catherine... and the mirror's starting to... SHOOTING ON THE BACK OF Brian's head, as he slowly turns around, sensing Catherine, as her shadow falls across his back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Brian wakes up again. Startled. Scared. Eyes racing around the room. Heart pounding. Sits up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee be ee

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just a dream. As Catherine suddenly sits up in bed right behind him! Black, insane eyes! Changed into a horror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAPPO! Brian wakes up a third time! Terrified. Looks around. Is this real? He checks the bed next to him. CLOSE SHOT: Brian. Staring intently. Now he slowly lifts his hand, moves it in, and his hand ENTERS FRAME, and we see it is Brian reaching out to touch his own reflection in that mirror on the door... CLOSE, SIDE ANGLE: the mirror, as Brian's fingers move toward the cold, polished surface of the mirror, touch it... CcuT TO BLACK. ROLL END CREDITS.
